did.unittitle: Office of the President Ruth J. Simmons papers
did.abstract: The collection contains records from the presidency of Ruth J. Simmons, including news clippings, inauguration records, and biographical information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in the Smith College Archives are open for use, with the following exceptions: "Office Files," files of records created for the use of the administrative unit that created them, are closed to research for a period of 10 years following their creation. Board of Trustees' records are closed permanently. In all cases, the College Archives will continue to provide public access to materials that were intended to be public at the time of their creation (press releases, publications, etc.)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ruth J. Simmons graduated from Dillard University, a private, liberal-arts black college in New Orleans, in 1967, before earning a doctorate at Harvard University in 1970. She made stops at the University of Southern California and at Princeton University, where she is largely credited with raising the profile of the black-studies program. She then served as an administrator at Spelman College. She was appointed president of Smith in 1995, the first black president of Smith College. In 2000, Brown University selected her as its 18th president, making her the first black president of an ivy league college. She retired in 2012, but in 2017 the Texas A&M System announced that Simmons would serve as interim president of Prairie View A&M.
